greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of chi(x) / chi(-x^10) in powers of x where chi() is a Ramanujan theta function.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q^(-3/8) * eta(q^2)^2 * eta(q^20) / (eta(q) * eta(q^4) * eta(q^10) ) in powers of q.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (640 t)) = 2^(-1/2) g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A145702.
mathematica: nmax = 100; CoefficientList[Series[Product[(1 + x^(2*k-1)) / (1 - x^(20*k-10)), {k, 1, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 30 2015 *)
a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ QPochhammer[ -x, x^2] QPochhammer[ -x^10, x^10], {x, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Sep 06 2015 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x^2 + A)^2 * eta(x^20 + A) / (eta(x + A) * eta(x^4 + A) * eta(x^10 + A)), n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Oct 17 2008
